episodeTitle: Formed! Luffy and Law's Pirate Alliance!
episodeTitleJapanese: 結成! ルフィ・ロー海賊同盟!
description: Luffy agrees to form an alliance with Trafalgar Law to take down one of the Four Emperors. Meanwhile, the crew learns about Caesar Clown's dangerous abilities, and Caesar's deadly pet Smiley begins attacking the G-5 Marines on Punk Hazard.

events.title: Law Proposes Alliance to Luffy
events.description: Trafalgar Law formally proposes a pirate alliance to Monkey D. Luffy, explaining he has a plan to take down one of the Four Emperors. Law presents this as one of the two ways to survive in the New World.
events.significance: This alliance becomes one of the most important partnerships in the New World, setting up the events of multiple arcs including Dressrosa and Wano. The formation of this alliance marks a turning point in Luffy's journey.

quotes.text: There are only two ways to survive in the New World: either go under the safety umbrella of an Emperor or consistently challenge them.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law explaining the harsh reality of the New World to Luffy

events.title: Law Reveals Target: One of the Four Emperors
events.description: Law reveals to Luffy that their alliance's goal is to depose one of the Four Emperors. He whispers the specific target's name to Luffy, which satisfies Luffy enough to agree to the alliance. Later it's confirmed the target is Kaido.
events.significance: This sets the long-term goal for the Luffy-Law alliance and establishes the narrative direction for the next several arcs. The choice of Kaido as the target relieves Luffy as he didn't want to fight Shanks first.

quotes.text: The chance of success is only 30%, but that's better than nothing.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law warning Luffy about the difficulty of their plan

events.title: Luffy Accepts Law's Alliance
events.description: Despite the crew's initial protests, Luffy agrees to form a pirate alliance with Trafalgar Law. Luffy states that even if Law isn't a 'good guy,' he trusts his crew and their strength, convincing them to go along with the plan.
events.significance: The official formation of the Luffy-Law Pirate Alliance, one of the most significant partnerships in One Piece. This alliance becomes crucial for the events of Punk Hazard, Dressrosa, and Wano arcs.

quotes.text: Even if you're not a good guy, I trust my crew and their strength!
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's reasoning for accepting the alliance despite concerns

events.title: Crew Reactions to the Alliance
events.description: The Straw Hat crew members react to the alliance proposal. Usopp and Chopper are fervently against it, while Nico Robin approves but warns Luffy about potential betrayal in pirate alliances. The rest express various concerns.
events.significance: Shows the different personalities and trust levels within the Straw Hat crew, with Robin's warning foreshadowing potential complications despite her approval.

quotes.text: Pirate alliances often end in betrayal. Are you sure about this, Luffy?
quotes.speaker: Nico Robin
quotes.context: Robin's warning to Luffy about the risks of the alliance

events.title: Law Performs Body Switches
events.description: Trafalgar Law uses his Ope Ope no Mi powers to switch bodies again. Franky and Chopper are returned to their original bodies, but Nami must remain in Sanji's body because her original body is not present at the location.
events.significance: Demonstrates Law's Devil Fruit abilities and resolves part of the ongoing body-switch complications from earlier in the arc, while maintaining the comedy of Nami being stuck in Sanji's body.

events.title: Caesar Clown's Bounty and Devil Fruit Revealed
events.description: Law informs the Straw Hats that Caesar Clown is a Logia-type Gas-Gas Fruit user with a bounty of 300 million berries. He emphasizes that only Haki users should confront Caesar due to his Logia abilities.
events.significance: Establishes Caesar Clown as a serious threat and introduces the challenge of fighting a Logia user, emphasizing the importance of Haki in the New World. This information shapes the crew's strategy.

quotes.text: Caesar Clown is a Logia-type Gas-Gas Fruit user with a 300 million berry bounty. Only Haki users should go up against him.
quotes.speaker: Trafalgar Law
quotes.context: Law explaining the threat level of Caesar Clown

events.title: Haki Users Selected for Caesar Mission
events.description: Law explains that only Haki users can effectively fight Caesar Clown. Luffy identifies the team as Law, Zoro, Sanji, and himself - the four crew members capable of using Haki at this point in the story.
events.significance: Highlights the power hierarchy within the group and the necessity of Haki in the New World, setting up the strike team for the assault on Caesar's laboratory.

quotes.text: So we're gonna kidnap the Master, right?
quotes.speaker: Monkey D. Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's straightforward understanding of their plan

events.title: Discussion of Caesar's Weapons of Mass Destruction
events.description: Law reveals that Caesar Clown possesses weapons of mass destruction and is the leading expert on chemical weapons, making him extremely dangerous beyond just his Devil Fruit powers.
events.significance: Establishes the broader threat that Caesar represents to the world and provides context for why the alliance wants to capture him. This connects to the larger themes of the Punk Hazard arc.

events.title: Smiley's Debut
events.description: Smiley, Caesar Clown's deadly pet creature, makes its first appearance. Smiley is a massive slime-like entity created from condensed H2S gas that has eaten the Sara Sara no Mi, Model: Axolotl Devil Fruit.
events.significance: Introduction of one of the arc's major threats and the first appearance of an object/creature that has consumed a Devil Fruit (Sara Sara no Mi, Model: Axolotl). Smiley represents Caesar's dangerous experiments.

events.title: Smiley Demonstrates Poison Gas Abilities
events.description: Smiley releases deadly poisonous gas from its body, killing several centaurs who are unable to escape. This demonstrates the lethal nature of Caesar's creation and the danger it poses to everyone on the island.
events.significance: Establishes Smiley as a major threat and showcases the deadly consequences of Caesar's experiments. This scene emphasizes the urgency of the Straw Hats' mission to save the children and stop Caesar.

events.title: G-5 Marines Encounter Smiley
events.description: The G-5 Marine unit encounters Smiley while outside Caesar's laboratory. The Marines are shocked and terrified by the massive creature, which begins to pursue them with its poisonous attacks.
events.significance: Sets up the immediate danger facing the G-5 Marines and creates tension as Smiley begins its rampage across Punk Hazard. This forces an unusual temporary alliance between Marines and pirates.

events.title: Straw Hats Refuse to Leave Without Saving the Children
events.description: Despite the alliance being formed and the plan being set, the Straw Hat Pirates, particularly Nami, refuse to leave Punk Hazard until the kidnapped children are rescued from Caesar's experiments. This shows the crew's moral compass.
events.significance: Demonstrates the Straw Hats' core values and compassion, particularly Nami's protective nature toward children. This decision becomes central to their actions throughout the Punk Hazard arc and affects their strategy.

events.title: Gigantification Discussion
events.description: Law discusses the concept of gigantification experiments being conducted on the children at Punk Hazard. This reveals part of Caesar's cruel experimentation and the children's predicament.
events.significance: Provides context for why the children are so large and reveals the sinister nature of Caesar's experiments, including the addictive drugs and shortened lifespans caused by the gigantification process.

themes.description: The episode explores the concept of pirate alliances, trust between crews, and the risks involved in partnering with others who may have different goals.
themes.symbolism: The alliance handshake between Luffy and Law represents a bond that will be tested throughout their journey.

themes.description: The Straw Hats' refusal to abandon the children demonstrates their core values and moral compass, even when it complicates their mission.
themes.symbolism: The children represent innocence corrupted by adults' ambitions, a recurring theme in One Piece.

themes.description: Law's plan has only a 30% success rate, but both crews are willing to risk everything to achieve their goals in the New World.
themes.symbolism: The dangerous alliance represents the high stakes of pursuing one's dreams in the treacherous New World.

characterSpotlights.development: Luffy shows growth in his willingness to form strategic alliances while maintaining his trust in his crew's strength and judgment.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extended the scenes of Smiley chasing the centaurs and G-5 Marines, adding more action sequences that weren't as detailed in the manga.
Some reaction shots from the Straw Hat crew members regarding the alliance were expanded in the anime for comedic effect.

trivia.fact: This episode adapts Chapter 668 of the manga, titled 'Pirate Alliance.'
Smiley is one of the few non-living objects shown to have consumed a Devil Fruit in the series, having eaten the Sara Sara no Mi, Model: Axolotl.
The opening theme 'Hands Up!' by Kota Shinzato was his debut single and peaked at #20 on the Oricon single chart.
Episode 594 aired in Japan on May 5, 2013, which is also Children's Day (Kodomo no Hi) in Japan, fitting given the episode's focus on saving children.
The Luffy-Law alliance becomes one of the longest-lasting alliances in One Piece, spanning multiple arcs including Punk Hazard, Dressrosa, and Wano.
This is the first time in the series that Luffy formally agrees to an equal partnership alliance with another pirate captain, showing his evolution as a leader.
